newsitem.title: ITALY: New Italy budget summit likely Weds - Bertinotti.
newsitem.headline: New Italy budget summit likely Weds - Bertinotti.

text.p: Parties supporting Italy's centre-left government will probably meet again on Wednesday to try to resolve remaining differences over the 1997 draft budget, hard left party leader Fausto Bertinotti said on Monday.
Bertinotti, whose Communist Refoundation party gives the government vital external support in the lower house of parliament, told reporters the summit would "very probably be on Wednesday".
A government statement issued earlier said some progress had been made at a similar meeting on Monday "but a few points of disagreement remain".
Bertinotti has spurned Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi's call for cuts in sensitive areas of welfare spending in the budget, which the government is expected to unveil later this week.
